thread.title: Briefs: Toddler struck by truck in street; Woman struck in Publix parking lot
thread.title_full: Briefs: Toddler struck by truck in street; Woman struck in Publix parking lot | Examiner.com

author: Kimathi Lewis
title: Briefs: Toddler struck by truck in street; Woman struck in Publix parking lot
text:
Bibb County deputies are investigating an incident in which a toddler was struck after running into the road near his home and Athens-Clarke County police are investigating an incident in which a woman was struck by a vehicle in a Publix parking lot. stock photo Toddler Injured After Running into Street
A 2-year-old boy was injured after he ran out into the road and was struck by a truck Friday in Bibb County. The incident happened shortly after 4:30 p.m. on Ell Street, according to the Bibb County Sheriff’s Office . Investigators said Dedruis Jones was playing in the front yard with his parents when he suddenly took off and ran down the driveway towards the road. Before anyone could catch him, the toddler ran into the road and was struck by a 2010 Ford Explorer, the sheriff’s spokesman Lt. Sean DeFoe said.
The driver, Steven Callison, of Dry Branch, told deputies he was traveling west on Ell Street when he noticed a small child running towards the road from a driveway, DeFoe said. Callison said he slammed on the brakes to avoid hitting the child, but he failed.
Paramedics arrived on the scene and transported the toddler to a local hospital where he was listed in serious but stable condition, DeFoe said. No one else was injured during the incident and no charges have been filed.
Woman Injured After Being Struck in Publix Parking Lot
A woman was struck as she was walking in a crosswalk Friday afternoon in Athens. But police said the driver will not be charged because the incident occurred on private property.
The incident happened around 1:20 p.m. in the parking lot of Publix on Barnett Shoals Road, according to the Athens-Clarke County police . Investigators said Alice Finley Piper, of Lexington, was driving a 2015 Buick Enclave in the parking lot.
When she turned left she struck a pedestrian who was walking in a crosswalk, spokeswoman Hilda Sorrow said. After being struck Karen Wooten, of Ponderosa Drive, was transported to Athens Regional Medical Center , Sorrow said.
